solution.text:
We should have a constant difference
For a list calculate the difference of any 2 consecutive terms
\(a_2=_{{j+k}}_ \) and \( a_1=_{j}_\) we get \(d=_{k}_\)
for next numbers \(a_3=_{{j+(k*2)}}_\) and \(\,a_2=_{{j+k}}_\) we get \(d=_{{(j+(2*k))-(j+k)}}_\)
The list is an AP when the difference of any two consecutive number is same, in the above case \(_{k}_\).

content.text: Which of the following list of numbers does form an AP?
